title: From Barron’s, August 26, 2019 (Part 1)
text:
[Italics-bold within the brackets are my additions/elaborations] [New M* Discussions doesn’t allow any colors for cut-and-paste from WORD]

MW Cover: Mark Weintraub [ Seaport Global ] projects moderate housing growth through 2020. He likes homebuilders KBH, LEN, DHI, PHM.

Pg M3, Trader: Ugly week! Tariffs overshadowed Fed speeches at Jackson Hole. SP500 is -5.9% below July 26 high but up +13.6% YTD. The selloff potential of -10% to -30% is there for this overpriced and overcrowded market but let us take it -10% at a time.

Ulta [ULTA; fwd P/E 23] is up +31.6% YTD but is still undervalued for its growth. Its 1,100 stores offer massive beauty selections and it uses celebrity endorsements effectively. There is no long-term debt.

3M [MMM; fwd P/E 16] is down but is not attractive. There are new potential environmental liabilities for PFAS and nothing has been reserved for those. It has high exposure to auto sector and China.

[The CME FedWatch tool, based on current fed fund futures quotes, shows the following probabilities for 2019:

For 2nd hike [cut], 0% for hike [100% for cut] at FOMC 9/18/19;

For 3rd hike [cut],

0% for hike [66.9% for cut] at FOMC 10/30/19;

0% for hike [78.7% for cut] at FOMC 12/11/19;

http://www.cmegroup.com/trading/interest-rates/countdown-to-fomc.html ]

For the week [index changes only], DJIA -0.99%, SP500 -1.44%, Nasdaq Comp -1.83%, Russell 2000 -2.29%. DJ Transports -2.28%; DJ Utilities +0.10%. US$ -0.99%, oil/WTI -1.28%, gold +0.93%.

YTD [index changes only], DJIA +9.87%, SP500 +13.57%, Nasdaq Comp +16.83%.

Pg M6, Europe: Overpriced UK luxury retailer Burberry [BRBY.uk/BURBY; fwd P/E 23] is facing challenges in its transformation due to higher capex and lower margins. Almost 41% of sales are from Asia.

Pg M6, Emerging Markets: It is too early to buy Turkey [TUR] – economy is in recession and recovery is faltering; inflation is 16%. Foreign debt is high and weakening lira makes the repayment situation worse. President Erdogan has installed a friendly management at the center bank that is expected to ease aggressively.

Pg M9, Commodities: Gasoline prices have fallen due to the US-China trade war and fears of slowdown. But weather and geopolitical events can suddenly affect gasoline and oil prices.

Pg M7, Options: Buying calls and/or selling puts are recommended ahead of COST earnings on Oct 3.

[SP500 VIX 19.87, SKEW 112.62] [10-Yr TYVIX 5.59][Yahoo Finance data]

Pg M24, M29: An up week in Europe [Greece +5.32, Denmark +1.50%, Spain -0.53%] [Europe was closed by the time tariff fireworks started on Friday, so it should catchup on Monday] and a good week in Asia [Australia +1.91%, India -1.83%] [same comment as for Europe applies to Asia]. The equity CEF index [data to Thursday] underperformed the DJIA and its discount was -6%.

Treasury rates 3-mo yield 1.97%, 2-yr 1.51%, 5-yr 1.40%, 10-yr 1.52%, 30-yr 2.02% [Treasury data*]. Dollar fell, DXY 97.64, -0.6% [M32]. Gold fell to $1,504, -0.8% [notable deviation from pg M3]; the gold-miners rallied [M34]. [^XAU was at 97.78, +5.32% for the week]

*Treasury Yield-Curve https://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/data-chart-center/interest-rates/Pages/TextView.aspx?data=y...

Top FDIC insured savings deposit rates*: Money-market accounts 2.37%; 1-yr CDs 2.37%; 5-yr CDs 2.76% [M30].

*For local rates https://www.depositaccounts.com/banks/rates-map/

Pg 14: Cover Story, “Football and The Future of TV”.

Advisory Directory supplement with some features related to recession shelters [see Part 2 for selected features].

Pg 5, Up & Down Wall Street: What happened to Summer doldrums? SP500 is down -4.5% in August so far. President Trump continued his tweets on the Fed, tariffs on China, Allies ahead of G-7, and ordered the US companies to seek alternatives to China. Market strategists may start revising their SP500 targets and timetable for recession.

HK CK Hutchinson is attractive [CHHUY; yield 4.5%; fwd P/E 7; P/B 0.6]; almost 85% of its earnings are outside of HK and China. US billboard company Clear Channel Outdoor is attractive [CCO; fwd EV/EBITDA 10]; stock is depressed because its former controlling owner IHRT distributed millions of CCO shares to creditors as part of bankruptcy exit, and CCO also issued additional shares to tap into opportunities in its fragmented market. As Warren Buffett turns 89, BRK-A/B is attractive [P/B 1.3]; stock Is suffering from 27% stake in KHC; someday its parts would be more valuable than the sum.

Pg 7, Streetwise: New ethical-industrial complex says that doing good things [for employees, customers and economy] will also lead to higher profits, but there won’t be a focus on just maximizing profits. RTN, MO are touting their good deeds. Come car companies [F, HMC, etc] have agreed to tougher CA targets for mileage and emissions. Several companies [WMT, TGT, AMZN, etc] have set minimum wages higher than the federal standard. CB will stop insuring companies that get more than 30% of their revenues from coal. Listen, but be careful about company claims and be skeptical.

More later….

YBB
